critique: This document concerns the opening of public lands in New Mexico to homesteading and desert land laws, specifically prioritizing ex-service men of the War with Germany. It revokes a previous order withdrawing these lands pending a resurvey. There's a slight tilt towards favoring a specific group (veterans) but otherwise seems fairly neutral regarding modern political issues. It doesn't expand executive power significantly, mainly executing existing laws. Federalism is somewhat implicated as it deals with federal lands, but it's more about land management than a power shift. There's no clear indication of impact on national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion in a modern sense.
